content.description: If you know you know a slice of pie so good, you'll want more. Climb very fun and interesting holds on a low angle face. Move up through expensive-looking holds before a small roof encounter. Good grips takes you to the top.
content.location: Start just right of a wide hands crack and a ledge. Leave the dirt towards a crack-like, squiggle grip, and climb straight up the face.

climbs.name: Isn't It Gneiss
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook

content.description: Well... isn't it?! Isn't It Gneiss has very fun, obvious climbing on gneiss-like rock. Psychedelic swirls of stone and some interesting movement make this one very...nice.
content.location:
Leave

terra firma

up onto a ledge above the trail, and follow gneiss holds up towards a small roof encounter and some more gneiss holds.

climbs.name: Go and Flow
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, J. Cook

content.description:
Go and Flow is a nicely flowing route that meanders up the right side of the High Fruit Slab. It has steep jugs but enough relief to make it a great moderate.

Just like...go with the flow.
content.protection:
Bolts and a b

olted anchor.
content.location: On the right side of the High Fruit Wall, look for steep, overhanging, bucket grips out a short bulge.

climbs.name: Bananas for Banana Bread
climbs.fa: FoCo OS, J. Snyder, N. Cole

content.description: Go crazy for some bananas climbing. The easiest route at the crag, this thing has fun all over it. Bake and enjoy.
content.location: Leave the dirt up towards a large ledge. The 1st bolt is above and appears "high off the ground" but is easy to clip. Move up towards the stem, and don't slip on a peel before moving around right of a small bulge and into hilariously easier climbing.
